h1: Calories in One Pound of Ground Beef
assumptions: 80% lean/20% fat, pan-broiled (cooked), excess fat drained; 1 pound = 454 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by lean percentage, cooking method, draining, and brand; raw vs. cooked weights differ. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One pound of cooked 80% lean ground beef provides ~1226 kcal and ~113 g protein.

label_note: Totals are scaled from the per-100 g basis and mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp oil during cooking per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in one pound of cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: About 1226 kcal for 80% lean, pan-broiled and drained.

faqs.q: What's the protein in one pound of ground beef?
faqs.a: Approximately 113 g protein, making it a high-protein option.

faqs.q: Does lean percentage affect calories in ground beef?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”90% lean has fewer calories (~215 kcal/100 g) than 80% lean (~270 kcal/100 g).

faqs.q: Are these calories for raw or cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: Cooked (pan-broiled); raw is lower per weight due to moisture loss during cooking.

faqs.q: How much fat is in one pound of 80/20 ground beef?
faqs.a: About 82 g total fat, including 32 g saturated, after cooking and draining.
